meanings.sent1: The embossed cover of the book felt bumpy.
meanings.sent2: She admired the embossed patterns on the greeting card.
meanings.sent3: The embossed cake looked fancy and elegant.
meanings.sent4: The embossed logo on the bag made it stand out.
meanings.sent5: The embossed seal on the certificate added a touch of sophistication.

meanings.definition: To carve, mold, or stamp a design onto a surface.
meanings.sent1: He embossed his initials on the leather wallet.
meanings.sent2: The artist embossed intricate patterns on the metal sheet.
meanings.sent3: She playfully embossed smiley faces on the clay.
meanings.sent4: The craftsman embossed the emblem with precision.
meanings.sent5: They embossed their logo on the product for branding.

meanings.definition: To make a surface raised or indented.
meanings.sent1: The machine embossed the paper with a floral design.
meanings.sent2: She embossed her name on the wet cement.
meanings.sent3: The child embossed shapes on the playdough.
meanings.sent4: The potter embossed the clay with intricate patterns.
meanings.sent5: The jeweler embossed the metal with a unique texture.
